trans-unit.source: Provides a context-enabled binding for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetTcpContextBinding"></xref> binding.

When calling a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service built with.Net Framework 4.0 from a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client application built with [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] or earlier, the configuration file generated by svcutil.exe or adding a service reference from [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] will contain the contextManagementEnabled attribute in the binding configuration.

This attribute is not recognized by the [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] runtime and the application will thrown an <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationErrorsException> with the message "Unrecognized attribute 'contextManagementEnabled".
To workaround this problem, remove the contextManagementEnabled attribute from the binding configuration.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetTcpContextBinding"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetTcpContextBinding"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode"></xref>.
The security mode.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetTcpContextBinding"></xref> class with the specified binding configuration.
The `configName` parameter should be set to the name of the `<binding>` element in the configuration file that configures this binding.
The name of the binding configuration.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetTcpContextBinding"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode"></xref> and reliable session setting.
The security mode.
`true` to enable reliable sessions; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the client callback address.
The client callback address.
Gets a value that specifies whether context management is enabled.
`true` if context management is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the context protection level for this binding.
The protection level for the binding.
Creates an ordered collection of binding elements that are contained in the current binding.
The collection contains a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextBindingElement> that enables SOAP headers to be used to exchange context information.

A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElementCollection"></xref> that contains the ordered stack of binding elements described by the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetTcpContextBinding"></xref>.
